III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the
ability, experience, education, and training to perform the
duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Alleged that foster care worker took a photo of a foster child
in her underwear.
Investigation A DHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on July 14, 2023.
The DHHS Worker reported that information she had obtained
indicated that no photographs of Youth A were on the phone of
Staff 1. The DHHS Worker reported that the complaint had been
sent back to Central Intake for reconsideration.
The DHHS Worker reported on July 17, 2023, the complaint was
withdrawn, and she would not be conducting an investigation.
The agency Chief Administrator was interviewed via
telephone on July 18, 2023.
The Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1 had visited Relative
1’s home on June 30, 2023, to initiate an intake with Youth A as
the case was new. The Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1
had conducted the intake but forgot to take a picture of Youth A.
The Chief Administrator reported that on or about July 11th or 12th,
2023, Relative 1 had called and said that Youth A had stated that
Staff 1 had taken a photo of her in her underwear. The Chief
Administrator reported that Relative 1 reported that it was not true
as Youth A had stated that Staff 1 had forgotten to take any
picture of her during the intake. The Chief Administrator reported
that the cell phone of Staff 1 was reviewed and there were no
pictures of Youth A on her phone. The Chief Administrator did
report that on the day of the intake Staff 1 had conducted a “body
map” of youth A to record any bruises or scars and the “body
map” of Youth A was conducted while she was in her underwear.
The Chief Administrator reported that since Youth A is thirteen
years old this should not have happened. The Chief Administrator
reported that Staff 1 usually works with infants on her caseload
and taking photos of infants in a diaper is appropriate. The Chief
Administrator reported that since Staff 1 was used to working with
infants she thought “body mapping” of Youth A in her underwear
was part of intake procedure. The Chief Administrator reported
2

that the agency has since implemented procedures for workers
conducting intakes and “body mapping” of older children in their
underwear is prohibited.
Relative 1 was interviewed via telephone on July 28, 2023.
Relative 1 reported that after Staff 1 had completed the intake on
June 30, 2023, and left the house Youth A reported to her that
Staff 1 had forgotten to take a picture of her. Relative 1 reported
that a couple of weeks later Youth A had told Relative 1’s sister,
hereafter referred to as Relative 2, that Staff 1 had taken a picture
of her in her underwear. Relative 1 reported that there is no
evidence that Staff 1 took a picture of Youth A in her underwear
and reiterated that right after the intake was completed Youth A
reported that Staff 1 had forgotten to take a picture of her.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on July 28, 2023.
Staff 1 denied that she had taken a picture of Youth A in her
underwear and had forgotten to take any picture of Youth A as is
required as a part of the intake process. Staff 1 did report that she
conducted a “body mapping” of youth A in her in underwear as
she thought that was the process for completing a thorough
mapping. Staff 1 reported that she mostly has worked with infants
and conducts body mapping when the infants is their diaper. Staff
1 reported that since this time the agency has developed
procedures for body mapping.
Relative 2 was interviewed via telephone on July 28, 2023.
Relative 2 reported that Youth A had said to her that Staff 1 had
taken pictures of her in her underwear. Relative 2 reported that
she did not think that happened and Youth A, “lies a lot”.
Youth A was interviewed via phone on July 28, 2023.
Youth A reported that at the time of Staff 1 conducting an intake
that she had forgotten to take a picture of her. Youth A reported
that Staff 1 did not take any pictures of her in her underwear or at
any other time. Youth A reported that she was in her underwear
as Staff 1 was checking for scars or bruises during the intake.
When asked, Youth A denied that she had told Relative 2 that
Staff 1 taken a picture of her in her underwear.
3

Analysis Youth A denied that Staff 1 had taken a picture of her in her
underwear. At the time of the intake completion Youth A had told
Relative 1 that Staff 1 had forgotten to take a picture of her. Youth
A further denied that she had told Relative 2 that Staff 1 had taken
a picture of her in her underwear.
Staff 1 denied that she had taken a picture of Youth A in her
underwear and reported that she had forgotten to take the intake
photo of Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued
